See Restatement (Second) of Torts \u00a7.raw_text: See Restatement (Second) of Torts §343 (liability to invitees for failure to remove or warn of dangerous conditions).
See Restatement (Second) of Torts \u00a7.proposition: Under Massachusetts law, an owner or occupier of land owes a duty to business invitees to exercise reasonable care to maintain the premises in a safe condition and to give warning of latent or concealed dangers known to the owner/occupier but not to the invitee.

M.G.L. c. 260, \u00a72A.proposition: Plaintiff gives notice that any applicable statute of limitations will be applied and preserved; generally, actions for personal injury in Massachusetts are governed by a three-year limitations period (see, e.g., M.G.L. c. 260, §2A), and this Complaint is timely filed within applicable limitations.
